‚ÄúThere‚Äôs so much crime in the city, I can‚Äôt comprehend how people live there.‚Äù

Rep. Marjorie Taylor described Eric Adams‚Äô New York City and the prosecution of Donald Trump by Alvin Bragg as ‚Äúdisgusting‚Äù during an appearance the Fox News program Tucker Carlson Tonight.

‚ÄúMayor [Eric] Adams described New York as ‚Äòhis home,‚Äô‚Äù Carlson said to Greene, asking ‚ÄúHow did his home look? Pretty neat and tidy?‚Äù

‚ÄúNo, his home is disgusting,‚Äù Greene replied. ‚ÄúI compare it to what I call Gotham City. The streets are filthy, they‚Äôre covered with people basically dying on drugs. They can‚Äôt even stand up; they‚Äôre falling over. There‚Äôs so much crime in the city, I can‚Äôt comprehend how people live there. It was repulsive, it smells bad. I think it‚Äôs a terrible place.‚Äù

‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù Carlson said. ‚ÄúWith some nice people, I will say that.‚Äù

Greene expounded further on the prosecution of Trump in a tweet.

‚ÄúDemocrats are so jealous,‚Äù Greene wrote. They don‚Äôt have a Donald Trump. They would give anything to have him. But they don‚Äôt. They‚Äôre like a jealous girl that got tossed to the side. They‚Äôre blinded by hate & jealousy and will do anything to stop him because they can‚Äôt have him. Psycho.‚Äù

Greene blasted Manhattan District Attorney Alvin Bragg as a ‚ÄúSoros funded tool‚Äù at a pro-Trump protest in New York before the former President‚Äôs arraignment.
Related VIDEO: Alex Stein Confronts CNN At Trump Tower, Calls Lib Journos 'The Scum Of The Earth'

Hundreds of Trump supporters turned out to a park in New York outside the Manhattan court house where President Trump was going to be arraigned, after he was subject to multiple charges in the state. Gavin Wax, the President of the New York Young Republican Club, helped organise the protest, and revealed that at the very least 500 turned out in support.

Greene proceeded to blast Alvin Bragg, the District Attorney that brought the charges against President Trump, as ‚Äúnothing but a George Soros funded tool,‚Äù at the pro-Trump protest, who was being used by the Democrats ‚Äúto try and hijack the 2024 presidential election.‚Äù

Trans-Terrorist Murder Plot Foiled in Colorado, Targeting THREE SCHOOLS

Targeting children again.

The left has been inciting the mentally disturbed to slaughter and this is the consequence.

And still no Nashville shooter manifesto. They‚Äôre hiding it.

BREAKING: Trans male arrested for planning Colorado school shooting, had anti-Trump manifesto

Whitworth faces charges of attempted murder after allegedly making threads against schools in Colorado Springs, Colo.

By: The Post Millennial, April 6, 2023:

A trans-identified male who goes by Lilly, though his given name is William Whitworth, was arrested and charged after a police investigation in Colorado Springs revealed that the 19-year-old was responsible for ‚Äúthreats involving schools in Colorado Springs Academy District 20.‚Äù

Whitworth faces charges of attempted murder after allegedly making threats against schools in Colorado Springs, Colo., according to local news.

The Elbert County Sheriff‚Äôs Office charged Whitworth with two counts of a criminal attempt to commit murder in the first degree, criminal mischief, menacing, and interference with staff, faculty or students of educational institutions.

Whitworth is an alum of the school district and attended from 2014-16. Whitworth had attended Timberview Middle School in District 20, and an affidavit showed that this was the school Whitworth planned to target, for ‚Äúno specific reason.‚Äù

The investigation began after the sheriff‚Äôs office was dispatched on March 31 due to a disturbance.

Deputies spoke with someone at the door on that day, and learned that another individual inside was ‚Äúvery upset and punched holes inside the walls.‚Äù Deputies, however, were not immediately allowed access to the residence.

Once inside, however, deputies found signs that someone had been punching holes in walls, and had ripped doors off their hinges. The person who reported the disturbance was reportedly Whitworth‚Äôs sister.

Deputies asked Whitworth if he had an intention of harming people at a school, and according to an affidavit, Whitworth indicated that this was the intention.

When asked why, Whitworth said ‚ÄúWhy does anyone do it.‚Äù

Whitworth, deputies noted, appeared to be drunk and made suicidal statements. Additional targets per Whitworth‚Äôs manifesto were churches, and the planning had been ongoing for a month. Whitworth told officers that he had learned how to make a detonation device on YouTube.

Whitworth‚Äôs manifesto had a list of school people and shooters with notes next to their names:

‚ÄúEric and Dylan: Losers
‚ÄúAdam Lanza: To smart
‚ÄúIsreal Keyes: Degenerate
‚ÄúLauren Southern: Pathetic
‚ÄúVaush: Terrorist
‚ÄúDonald J. Trump: Con-mam
‚ÄúBad cops: Useless garbage
‚ÄúStockholm, Name: Liam K.‚Äù

The manifesto‚Äôs contents detailed:

‚ÄúA list of firearms and how to 3D print them; Detailed lists of numerous named individuals to be killed and their indented casualty versus injury rate. Information detailing the creation of improvised explosive devices; The Finalization of locations being Timberview Middle School, Prairie Hills Elementary, and Pine Creek High School.‚Äù

This comes after trans-identified female Audrey Hale shot 3 children and 3 adults to death in The Covenant School in Nashville, Tennessee.

card.title: No One Is Above the Law? Give Me a Break

_source.content: By David HarsanyiApril 7, 2023CommentaryLock Donald Trump up, or don‚Äôt lock him up, but don‚Äôt tell me that ‚Äúno one is above the law.‚Äù It‚Äôs one of the most ludicrous fantasies peddled by the left.Plenty of people are ‚Äúabove the law.‚Äù James Clapper, who lied under oath to Congress about spying on the American people, is above the law. John Brennan, who lied about a domestic spying operation on Senate staffers, is above the law. Unlike Trump adviser Peter Navarro, Obama‚Äôs Attorney General Eric Holder was never going to be handcuffed and thrown in prison for ignoring a congressional subpoena. He is above the law.Trump‚Äôs 2016 opponent, Hillary Clinton, is also above the law. The then-secretary of state set up a private server in her home to circumvent transparency surrounding her slush fund foundation. She sent 110 emails containing marked classified information, and 36 of those emails contained secret information. Eight of the email chains contained ‚Äútop secret‚Äù information. Every one of those instances was a potential felony punishable with up to 10 years in prison.We learned all of this from James Comey, then FBI director, who noted that Clinton had been ‚Äúextremely careless‚Äù in conducting her business. Comey didn‚Äôt recommend charges because, he claimed, the state couldn‚Äôt prove Clinton‚Äôs intent‚Äîeven though ‚Äúgross negligence,‚Äù not intent, was the only standard he needed. Gross negligence and extreme carelessness are synonyms. Comey concocted a new standard to protect Clinton because she is above the law.When Hillary‚Äôs husband, also above the law, perjured himself under oath, Democrats argued that puritanical conservatives were only pursuing Bill because of some trumped-up charge over ‚Äúsex.‚Äù Using that logic, Trump‚Äôs campaign finance charges related to Stormy Daniels‚Äô ‚Äúhush money‚Äù are also about sex. This is different because Trump is the boogeyman, and everyone knows he‚Äôs guilty of something. The important thing is getting that mug shot.Don‚Äôt worry, though; former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi says, ‚ÄúEveryone has the right to a trial to prove innocence.‚Äù By ‚Äúeveryone,‚Äù she means Republicans. And if you think this authoritarian formulation is an accident, you haven‚Äôt been paying attention. When Democrats were smearing Brett Kavanaugh as a (gang) rapist a few years back, Sen. Mazie Hirono was asked whether the then-nominee deserved the ‚Äúsame presumption of innocence as anyone else in America?‚Äù After all, this wasn‚Äôt about any judicial disagreement but about alleged criminal behavior. The Hawaii senator responded, ‚ÄúI put his denial in the context of everything that I know about him in terms of how he approaches his cases.‚ÄùIn other words, if you‚Äôre a conservative, your politics are evil; and if your politics are evil, you‚Äôre probably evil. I imagine that was the rationalization used by Kamala Harris when reading obvious fabrications about Kavanaugh into the Congressional Record. It is likely the rationalization of Lois Lerner or Merrick Garland‚Äîboth above the law‚Äîwhen they weaponized government agencies against political opponents. It is almost surely the rationalization of Manhattan District Attorney Alvin Bragg. This is what justifies the contemporary left‚Äôs increasing comfort with deploying the state to punish and destroy political enemies. For many progressives, the legal system isn‚Äôt merely a tool for criminal justice (if that) but a way to exact poetic political justice.Despite there being perfectly sound political arguments against Trump, we have been on a hysterical journey that has taken us from accusing Trump of being a seditious actor working on the orders of an antagonistic foreign government‚Äîthe most successful conspiracy theory ever spun in American politics‚Äîto indicting him on some rickety seven-year-old campaign finance violation charge. Giving a porn star ‚Äúhush money‚Äù is an immorality, not an illegality. Are DAs now going to be in the business of indicting political opponents who put $130,000 on the wrong side of the ledger during a race that cost hundreds of millions of dollars? I look forward to this kind of justice being meted out equally‚Ä¶.[Click on my reply(ies) or link below for rest of article] https://www.theepochtimes.com/no-one-is-above-the-law-give-me-a-break_5180242.html?utm_source=share-btn-copylink
_source.contentraw:
By David Harsanyi
April 7, 2023

Commentary

Lock Donald Trump up, or don‚Äôt lock him up, but don‚Äôt tell me that ‚Äúno one is above the law.‚Äù It‚Äôs one of the most ludicrous fantasies peddled by the left.

Plenty of people are ‚Äúabove the law.‚Äù James Clapper, who lied under oath to Congress about spying on the American people, is above the law. John Brennan, who lied about a domestic spying operation on Senate staffers, is above the law. Unlike Trump adviser Peter Navarro, Obama‚Äôs Attorney General Eric Holder was never going to be handcuffed and thrown in prison for ignoring a congressional subpoena. He is above the law.

Trump‚Äôs 2016 opponent, Hillary Clinton, is also above the law. The then-secretary of state set up a private server in her home to circumvent transparency surrounding her slush fund foundation. She sent 110 emails containing marked classified information, and 36 of those emails contained secret information. Eight of the email chains contained ‚Äútop secret‚Äù information. Every one of those instances was a potential felony punishable with up to 10 years in prison.

We learned all of this from James Comey, then FBI director, who noted that Clinton had been ‚Äúextremely careless‚Äù in conducting her business. Comey didn‚Äôt recommend charges because, he claimed, the state couldn‚Äôt prove Clinton‚Äôs intent‚Äîeven though ‚Äúgross negligence,‚Äù not intent, was the only standard he needed. Gross negligence and extreme carelessness are synonyms. Comey concocted a new standard to protect Clinton because she is above the law.

When Hillary‚Äôs husband, also above the law, perjured himself under oath, Democrats argued that puritanical conservatives were only pursuing Bill because of some trumped-up charge over ‚Äúsex.‚Äù Using that logic, Trump‚Äôs campaign finance charges related to Stormy Daniels‚Äô ‚Äúhush money‚Äù are also about sex. This is different because Trump is the boogeyman, and everyone knows he‚Äôs guilty of something. The important thing is getting that mug shot.

Don‚Äôt worry, though; former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi says, ‚ÄúEveryone has the right to a trial to prove innocence.‚Äù By ‚Äúeveryone,‚Äù she means Republicans. And if you think this authoritarian formulation is an accident, you haven‚Äôt been paying attention. When Democrats were smearing Brett Kavanaugh as a (gang) rapist a few years back, Sen. Mazie Hirono was asked whether the then-nominee deserved the ‚Äúsame presumption of innocence as anyone else in America?‚Äù After all, this wasn‚Äôt about any judicial disagreement but about alleged criminal behavior. The Hawaii senator responded, ‚ÄúI put his denial in the context of everything that I know about him in terms of how he approaches his cases.‚Äù

In other words, if you‚Äôre a conservative, your politics are evil; and if your politics are evil, you‚Äôre probably evil. I imagine that was the rationalization used by Kamala Harris when reading obvious fabrications about Kavanaugh into the Congressional Record. It is likely the rationalization of Lois Lerner or Merrick Garland‚Äîboth above the law‚Äîwhen they weaponized government agencies against political opponents. It is almost surely the rationalization of Manhattan District Attorney Alvin Bragg. This is what justifies the contemporary left‚Äôs increasing comfort with deploying the state to punish and destroy political enemies. For many progressives, the legal system isn‚Äôt merely a tool for criminal justice (if that) but a way to exact poetic political justice.

Despite there being perfectly sound political arguments against Trump, we have been on a hysterical journey that has taken us from accusing Trump of being a seditious actor working on the orders of an antagonistic foreign government‚Äîthe most successful conspiracy theory ever spun in American politics‚Äîto indicting him on some rickety seven-year-old campaign finance violation charge. Giving a porn star ‚Äúhush money‚Äù is an immorality, not an illegality. Are DAs now going to be in the business of indicting political opponents who put $130,000 on the wrong side of the ledger during a race that cost hundreds of millions of dollars? I look forward to this kind of justice being meted out equally‚Ä¶.

[Click on my reply(ies) or link below for rest of article]
https://www.theepochtimes.com/no-one-is-above-the-law-give-me-a-break_5180242.html?utm_source=share-btn-copylink
